intro: Canthium trachystyle, commonly known as the short-styled canthium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rough, often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Canthium trachystyle is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments within its native range.
